semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Overdose of Insulin Due to Insulin Pump Failure
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 4. Chapter 4: Endocrine, Nutritional, and Metabolic Diseases > a. Diabetes mellitus > 5) Complications due to insulin pump malfunction > (b) Overdose of insulin due to insulin pump failure

content.full_text: The principal or first-listed code for an encounter due to an insulin pump malfunction resulting in an overdose of insulin, should also be T85.6-, Mechanical complication of other specified internal and external prosthetic devices, implants and grafts, followed by code T38.3X1-, Poisoning by insulin and oral hypoglycemic [antidiabetic] drugs, accidental (unintentional). (Evidence: pg no: 41, L62-L64)
content.summary: Coding sequence for insulin pump failure causing overdose: T85.6- first, then T38.3X1- for accidental poisoning (Evidence: pg no: 41, L62-L64)
key_concepts: T85.6- code first for pump mechanical complication (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63-L64)
T38.3X1- code second for accidental poisoning (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign T85.6- as principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63-L64)
detailed_rules.explanation: For insulin overdose due to pump malfunction, assign T85.6- for mechanical complication of prosthetic devices as the principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63-L64)
common_applications: Pump malfunction causing excess insulin delivery

detailed_rules.rule_text: Follow with T38.3X1- for accidental poisoning (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)
detailed_rules.explanation: After the pump malfunction code, assign T38.3X1- for poisoning by insulin and oral hypoglycemic antidiabetic drugs, accidental (unintentional) (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)
common_applications: Unintentional insulin poisoning from pump failure

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify insulin pump failure causing overdose
Step 2: Assign T85.6- code for specific pump malfunction as principal/first-listed
Step 3: Assign T38.3X1- for accidental poisoning as secondary code
Step 4: Add any additional codes for effects of overdose

code_ranges.description: Mechanical complication of other specified internal and external prosthetic devices, implants and grafts (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63-L64)
code_ranges.requirement: Principal or first-listed code for pump malfunction
usage_rules: Use as principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63)

code_ranges.description: Poisoning by insulin and oral hypoglycemic [antidiabetic] drugs, accidental (unintentional) (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)
usage_rules: Follow T85.6- code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Insulin pump malfunction causing insulin overdose and hypoglycemia
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient with insulin pump malfunction resulting in overdose of insulin and severe hypoglycemia
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify pump malfunction causing overdose
Step 2: Assign T85.614A as principal code
Step 3: Assign T38.3X1A for accidental poisoning
Step 4: Add codes for hypoglycemia effects

correct_coding.rationale: Mechanical complication is principal cause of accidental overdose (Evidence: pg no: 41, L62-L64)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should sequence pump failure before poisoning

breakdown.T85.614A: Breakdown of insulin pump, initial encounter (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63-L64)
breakdown.T38.3X1A: Accidental poisoning by insulin, initial encounter (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)

examples.rationale: Proper sequencing with mechanical complication first (Evidence: pg no: 41, L62-L64)

warnings: T85.6- must be principal or first-listed code (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63)
Use accidental poisoning code T38.3X1- not intentional (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)
best_practices: Sequence mechanical complication before poisoning (Evidence: pg no: 41, L62-L64)
Consider additional codes for overdose effects
common_mistakes: Using intentional poisoning codes instead of accidental
tips: Pump malfunction makes overdose accidental/unintentional (Evidence: pg no: 41, L64)
Mechanical cause takes precedence in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 41, L63)
implementation_notes: Requires identification of pump malfunction type
May need additional codes for hypoglycemia or other effects
